meanings.definition: Moors: a tract of open uncultivated upland; a heath.
meanings.sent1: The sheep grazed peacefully on the moors.
meanings.sent2: The hikers enjoyed the scenic views of the moors during their trek.
meanings.sent3: The moors seemed to whisper secrets to the passing clouds.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a vast moors of untapped creativity.
meanings.sent5: The eerie mist enveloped the moors, creating an otherworldly atmosphere.

meanings.definition: Moors: a member of a northwestern African Muslim people of mixed Berber and Arab descent.
meanings.sent1: The Moors were known for their rich cultural heritage.
meanings.sent2: Many Moors settled in Spain during the medieval period.
meanings.sent3: The Moors celebrated their traditions with colorful festivals.
meanings.sent4: Her elegant attire reflected her Moorish ancestry.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic music of the Moors filled the streets with joy.
